title: Has the quality of canned tuna declined in the past several decades? - Quora

response.answer_text: Canned tuna has undergone a serious deterioration in quality over the past several decades. I would venture that the craze for sushi has driven much of this. When I was a youth, a typical can of tuna would contain a “bullseye” of whole steak surrounded by fragments of meat. Now, even cans labeled “chunk” frequently are little more than mush. The low-end brands are almost a purée and only the very most expensive types have a whole piece of meat. Confirmation of this came recently when I noticed how canned salmon often has better flavor and texture than a lot of regular tuna.
